TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs> class is used to supply event values to the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event and to enable you to specify a custom Windows identity for the current request.
The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> constructs a <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs> object using the Windows identity supplied by IIS and the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> and passes it to the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.User%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs> object supplied to the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event to set the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.User%2A> property of the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> to a custom <xref:System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal> object. If you do not specify a value for the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.User%2A> property during the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event, the Windows identity supplied by IIS is used as the identity for the current request. If IIS uses anonymous authentication, then the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.Identity%2A> property is set to the identity returned by the <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.GetAnonymous%2A> method.
The **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event is raised only when the authentication <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationSection.Mode%2A> is set to <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.Windows> and the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> is an active HTTP module for the application.
## Examples The following code example uses the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event to set the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.User%2A> property of the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> to a custom <xref:System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal> object.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule/CS/global.asax#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule/VB/global.asax#1)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a newly created instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> constructs a <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs> object using the Windows identity supplied by IIS and the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> and passes it to the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event.

Docs.summary: Gets the object for the current HTTP request.
Docs.value: The object for the current HTTP request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> provides access to <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Request%2A>, <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Response%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.User%2A> objects for the current request.

Docs.summary: Gets the Windows identity passed to the constructor.
Docs.value: The Windows identity passed to the constructor.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> constructs a <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs> object using the Windows identity supplied by IIS and the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> and passes it to the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event.
If IIS uses anonymous authentication, the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.Identity%2A> property is set to the identity returned by the <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.GetAnonymous%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example uses the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event to set the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.User%2A> property of the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> to a custom <xref:System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal> object.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the object to be associated with the current request.
Docs.value: The object to be associated with the current request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.User%2A> property to set the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.User%2A> property of the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> to a custom <xref:System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal> object.
If you do not specify a value for the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.User%2A> property during the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event, the Windows identity supplied by IIS is used as the identity for the current request. If IIS uses anonymous authentication, then the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.Identity%2A> property is set to the identity returned by the <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.GetAnonymous%2A> method.
